titlestmt.titleproper: Armistead Peter, Jr. papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:59:38 -0400.

did.unittitle: Armistead Peter, Jr. papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The microfilmed Armistead Peter, Jr. Papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett contain scattered correspondence between Armistead Peter, Jr. And Paul Wayland Bartlett regarding family matters and a gift of a bronze eagle (1920-1925); and printed materials, cincluding news clippings and a program about Bartlett's statue of Benjamin Franklin (1921), as well as two published articles about Bartlett (1923 and 1925).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 4903 (fr. 1143-1186) available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in: The Tudor Place Foundation, Inc., Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Armistead Peter, Jr. (1870-1960) was father-in-law to Caroline Ogden-Jones Peter(1894-1965), who was the daughter of Suzanne Bartlett and stepdaughter of sculptor Paul Wayland Bartlett (1865-1925).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming by The Tudor Place Foundation, Inc. in 1994 along with the Paul Wayland Bartlett papers, and papers of Suzanne Bartlett and Caroline Ogden-Jones relating to Paul W. Bartlett (each group has been cataloged separately). The Tudor Place Foundation, Inc. inherited these papers in 1984 with the estate of Armistead Peter III of Tudor Place.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Archives of American Art also holds the microfilmed Paul Wayland Bartlett papers, 1887-1925; the microfilmed Suzanne Bartlett papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett, circa 1883-1950s; and the microfilmed Caroline Ogden-Jones Peter papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett, 1955-1965. The Library of Congress Manuscript Division holds the Paul Wayland Bartlett papers, 1875-1959.
